meanings.definition: A small piece or fragment broken off from something larger.
meanings.sent1: I found a chipping of wood on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The chipping of the vase made it look imperfect.
meanings.sent3: The chipping of the cookie made it easier to share.
meanings.sent4: The chipping of the iceberg revealed its true size.
meanings.sent5: The chipping of the rock revealed a shiny mineral inside.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting or breaking off small pieces.
meanings.sent1: Her chipping of the wood was precise and neat.
meanings.sent2: The chipping of the ice required a sharp tool.
meanings.sent3: The chipping of the chocolate was a messy but fun task.
meanings.sent4: The chipping of the paint revealed the original color of the wall.
meanings.sent5: The chipping of the pencil led to a perfectly sharpened tip.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a bird or squirrel.
meanings.sent1: The chipping of the bird signaled the start of the day.
meanings.sent2: The chipping of the squirrel could be heard from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The chipping of the bird made the forest feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The chipping of the squirrel added to the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The chipping of the bird echoed through the quiet morning.
